intro: Aegiphila manabaea, commonly known as the Manabean ironwood, is a shrub native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, small opposite leaves, and clusters of pale blue to purple flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
